website_summaries.verdict: This tree stand is portable and temporary. It allows you to lift your stand into a tree while you climb.
pros: Best for trees with straight trunk without branches in the way
cons: While this frame is considerably lighter than a steel-framed stand, it still weighs about 20 lb

customer_reviews.title: 99% happy - would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.text: Takes a few climbs to get fully used to it but once you are it’s a breeze - and it’s still pretty easy before then. The only negative is I wish the foot platform piece extended another 6’ish inches. Only my heels rest on the platform while sitting. That said, I killed 2 deer in 3 days, within 15 yards, from the same tree using this stand. The climbing aspect of it let me get 25/30’ feet off the ground and the deer about walked under me. Both were about 125/130lbs and I was still able to drag them out while wearing the Treestand like a backpack. Lightweight, extremely mobile. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Aedifex

customer_reviews.title: Great investment - Female Hunter
customer_reviews.text: Solid product, relatively easy to use. I bought this for myself, I'm a female hunter, and wanted something I could handle on my own and feel safe hanging. This is it. It's very comfortable. Takes a couple times practicing to get the hang of it. Carrying straps aren't great but I started packing it on my Kuiu hiking back and it was not bad once I was using the pack frame rather than the backpack style straps for the stand itself. In terms of all day comfort 100%, not terribly heavy and simple enough I could be efficient and independent!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Very nice! Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice climbing stand! For the money a few things could be improved. Shoulder straps are very poor quality and need to be addressed. Also the top/bottom retaining lanyard is very poor quality with a light plastic clip. Might as well just use straps in place of the cheap plastic stirrups. They won’t last long. Other than those few things, which were easily taken care of, I would give this stand an A+. For around $300 per unit the quality could definitely be improved.
customer_reviews.author: TYLER WELLS

customer_reviews.title: ... was passed down to me which I couldn't be happier with but it's getting older so I decided to ...
customer_reviews.text: Have used an original summit that was passed down to me which I couldn't be happier with but it's getting older so I decided to get a new one. Well I ordered this viper and all in all I couldn't be happier other than some hardware was missing when it was delivered which was a little disappointing considering the price and reputation of summit. Granted two phone calls, one to amazon, and one to summit has resulted in the issue being resolved free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew H.

customer_reviews.title: Best of the all climbers!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve hunted in many climbing stands over the last 30 years and in my opinion Summit is the best. Pros: Safe, strong, rigid, easy to use, COMFORTABLE, gun and bow friendly, useful accessories and flexible to use on trees of variable sizes...safely! Cons: A little heavy to carry but worth it to have the strength and rigidity.
customer_reviews.author: SQ

customer_reviews.title: Great stand. Only for Straight trees without branches.
customer_reviews.text: This stand is well made, easy to climb with comfortable to sit in and feels very safe It seems much more comfortable and safe feeling than my hang-on stand. But it is only good for straight trees without branches. If you can only have one stand, I'd recommend a hang on stand so you have more options. If you can get a second stand, get this one. Another observation, it's a bit bulkier on my back than a hang-on stand but is about the same weight. Not much difference in the amount of noise it makes getting setup.
customer_reviews.author: 9a7ner

customer_reviews.title: Best stand i've ever climbed with
customer_reviews.text: Best stand i've ever climbed with. Instructions for assembly are almost useless, but common sense will help you get it together. It is very odd the way the carrying strap fits and it carry's way too low causing me to have to lean forward a bit to keep it off of my calves. My son is 6'2" and a very large frame has the same issue with His. I would purchase it again, but there needs to be some consideration on the carrying strap setup.
customer_reviews.author: Bro. B

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Got this the other day. When unboxing, I found the utility strap manufacture date was 12-2017, with a tag saying to replace it a year after manufacture date. I called Summit and they sent a replacement strap, whole process only took a a few minutes over the phone. These stands are awesome, and their customer service is just as awesome.
customer_reviews.author: NoxNoctura

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use once assembled
customer_reviews.text: This is my first climbing tree stand. I was so excited to receive this shipment! Luckily my husband has had many years of experience with a summit climbing stand, because the instructions, in my opinion are not to clear for assembly. So he was able to fill in the gaps in instructions. My maiden voyage up a tree went very well. I was pleasantly surprised as to the ease of use and comfort. It gives you much more flexibility and the fact that the seat is comfortable is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stand, with a few QC issues
customer_reviews.text: It came out of the box with several areas where the factory missed paint and there was very little to no paint and bare metal showing. Also, a few of the welds are kind of janky looking, but they did not have gaps so I will chalk it up to someone missing cleanup. The setup manual is horrible, though. It's not complicated to set-up at all, but with something that could be so dangerous if improperly used, I read the manual. The instructions for initial setup are not clear whatsoever. Once again: AWESOME PRODUCT, BAD QC
customer_reviews.author: Andrew McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Second climber
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second, identical climber for a different property...it is that good of a product! I have had the first one for 10 years and only have had to replace the plastic chain covers when they wear out from climbing pine trees. I don't use the climbing harness and strap that comes with this product since I already have upgraded that for comfort. I do save it for a guest though. It works fine, but takes a lot of work to strap in compared to aftermarket harnesses. I will buy this climber again when my daughter is old enough to climb. It is a very safe product and well designed.
customer_reviews.author: JMH Ale

customer_reviews.title: Summit tree stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice stand but I can’t see a person any larger than 180 lbs with hunting clothes on being very comfortable in it, as it would be a tight fit. The seat is extremely comfortable and the assembly was a snap. My only grip is that the foot platform should be 6 inches longer because my feet dangle. I’m going to weld an additional foot rest onto mine. Other than than that this is an excellent tree stand. The delivery was fast and it was packaged very well.
customer_reviews.author: ImAShopper

customer_reviews.title: Safe and portable.
customer_reviews.text: Things a pain to put together kinda but well worth it. Does not come with climber clips so be sure to order those as well. Other than that the thing is nice to use and carry. I'm 6' 170 wear size 12 boots and it's plenty big for me platform wise. Over all I like it and ready to put it to use and most importantly I feel safe in it.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Terrible directions and index of parts on assembly. It was also in a seriously bad order. The team on that needs firing immediately, because no one communicates that way or order in any language. Overall, this is a premier product for a great price. My wife gave it to me as a Christmas present, and I couldn’t be happier with it. Still waiting to get a kill out of it, but it’s gotten me into some great places and comfortably too.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Summit vipper
customer_reviews.text: These are great stands, had one for years. The backpack straps on this model. Is such garbage. No way to put them on straight. Going in trash. I will look somewhere else for backpack straps. No instructions except for the safety about harness. Nothing about on how to setup the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, sturdy climbing stand
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, sturdy climbing stand. I'm 5'9" and 220lb, and had no issue hooking it up to trees and climbing. The aluminum makes it nice and light to walk in long distances, much better than an old steel one that I had.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Ferrell

customer_reviews.title: This is my first climber and I absolutely love it. There are some modifications that need to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first climber and I absolutely love it. There are some modifications that need to be made to make it quieter and safer though. Summit should include stabilizer straps instead of the bungee strap. Purchased accessories from Third Hand Archery to make it custom to my liking. I did not use the seat so I cannot speak to it's comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Summit Fan
customer_reviews.text: I have use Summit stands for 20 years. I love they way they work and I would buy this stand again in a second. I would also suggest this stand to anyone interested in a climbing stand. Don't go cheap buy a Summit. The directions on how to set it up could be far better but someone who had no clue about this type of stand may get lost with the directions provided.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Seat is comfortable. Simple to use and easy to climb
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. These work very well. Seat is comfortable. Simple to use and easy to climb. The backpack straps for carrying are not great. If you plan to carry the stand long distances, you may want to rig up a better solution. Otherwise I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could use some standard improvements, but overall it’s a great tree stand.
customer_reviews.text: Pros • Lightweight, Quiet, Comfortable, Easy To Use. Cons • Cheap Fall Arrest System (I Bought The Summit Pro Harness For An Additional $90+), Footrest Should Come Standard And Not As An Add-On (I am 6’1” And Needed To Buy It). Assembly Instructions Omitted A Few Items (Anyone Who’s Slightly Mechanically Inclined Should Be Fine). Had To Buy Grip Tape For Better Platform Traction (Especially In Damp/Snowy Conditions).
customer_reviews.author: G. G.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my new climber.
customer_reviews.text: I used an Ole' Man steel climber for many, many years. Decided it was time to get a new one as it was getting very old and rather heavy compared to today's climbers. Went with the Summit Viper SD and love it. Very light but feels very strong (no give or bend) and very quiet. Only change was to put some padded camo tape on the arms to lay my rifle on. It's been perfect. Killed big buck 2nd week of using :) My new motto is ALWAYS USE A LIFE LINE !!!!! For any tree climbing, not this stand in particular !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Let's go hunting!!
customer_reviews.text: Came as described and easy assembled. Have not used but did try out and will be perfect for hunting season! Easy to carry and store. Highly recommended ****Edit.....Tree stand works great and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Best hunting stand made!
customer_reviews.text: I have hunted all my life, I've tried many different brands of climbers and the Summit viper is the absolute best. I own 4 overall and have gotten years of life. My first from the late 90's is still in action! Summit products have it all, ease of use, comfort and safety.
customer_reviews.author: Helton Jolly

customer_reviews.title: Works great, comfy
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed it holds my fat ass up in a tree, only weak part of the whole thing is a tree.
customer_reviews.author: skippyfixit

customer_reviews.title: Safety concern
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. One major concern. The cord keeping upper and lower from falling away has a plastic hook that's very had to unattach. Weak point that could be a major safety issue if the lower drops.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Shea

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: So far I've used this stand about 6 times. It's relatively easy to use (I've never owned a Treestand before this.) It climbs very well. The only cons I've found are the harness and carry straps. The harness is as basic as it gets, not very comfortable but would work. I upgraded to a hunter safety system. The other con is the carry straps. They work just fine, but if you're planning to carry this over 2 miles I'd consider an upgrade. Overall a great product, very easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler F

customer_reviews.title: Easy to climb, lightweight, quiet
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this and used it the day after receiving it. Easy to set up, and the manual and instructional video were both very helpful. Being new to a climbing stand, I was hesitant to buy this, but it made climbing easy! I do recommend purchasing a separate harness, but other than that, I love this.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Brown

customer_reviews.title: Light, safe and worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. The instructions will confuse you so just use common sense and youtube. Very light, easy to carry. I've fallen asleep in it a number of times. Bonus... I love the Amazon payment option using your personal credit card.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Good Treestand
customer_reviews.text: It works as intended. I find the foot section a bit small, but all of them are except the "Big Man" ones. I had to add my own expandable foam to the frame as I did not see any foam in the tubing at all. I was able to spray it in one end and it came out of the other end so there was no "special sound deadening foam" in mine. Not sure if this was an oversight on just mine or not. But I do like the product, especially the foot stirrups.
customer_reviews.author: William Gossett

customer_reviews.title: Good stand, bad instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Feels 20 pounds or lighter. Instructions are horrible. For an item that can put people life at risk if assembly wrong, they should be more throughly and show better pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M.

customer_reviews.title: Seats are no good.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite stand and I have owned and used MANY. BUT- quality has suffered over the past ten to 15 years. Especially where it is needed the MOST. THE SEAT! Lousy materials that don’t last, cheap buckles, and the seat won’t fold up out of your way. Bring back the rubber sling seats. Nothing has ever been as good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: “Summit, because your Safety is our priority”
customer_reviews.text: Loyal customer just replaced my old Summit climber with this. What can I say, it’s lightweight, durable and user friendly. When it comes to climbers this is the only brand that I will be with to climb up trees with my life on the line.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for trimming!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how good this product is for killing innocent animals from a treetop like a coward, but for trimming palm and coconut trees it’s great! I’m saving a lot of money from hiring tree trimmers that cost upwards of $500. #stopharminganimals
customer_reviews.author: Rosco Perez

customer_reviews.title: good price. I am 6'2" 220lbs
customer_reviews.text: Quality Stand, good price. I am 6'2" 220lbs, very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stand!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good quality stand that is fairly easy to use. I’d give it 5 stars if it would come with a foot rest. You can buy and install one separately, but it should be included. Without it, your legs have to stay I an uncomfortable position a lot.
customer_reviews.author: S and K Reviews

customer_reviews.title: It’s awesome
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, lightweight, safe, quiet, comfortable and keeps you mobile. Way better than any other climber I’ve seen used. My only complaint is the cables are a little hard to remove to set to the tree, but that’s at the cost of the coating to keep it quiet, which is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie

customer_reviews.title: Terrible assembly manual!
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst manual for assembly I’ve EVER used. 4 different stands in manual and none of it helped assemble the stand. I had to go to u-tube to watch videos. No cd included showing step by step process for assembling and using! For the price you pay recommend buying another brand highly dissatisfied!
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: great climber
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for his birthday. he loves climbing. I bought him this stand because of the great reviews that it received online. My only complaint is that the instructions are not very clear. It was difficult for him to set up. we had to google things in order to get it set up correctly. If they could improve the instructions I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: N. webber

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Stealthy and Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Great overall treestand, but assembly instructions were minimal. That being said, once it was together it worked well. The rubber around the cables make strapping to the tree silent during twilight. Very comfortable seat. The stirrups help tremendously climbing up and down from trees. I would recommend upgrading the back straps if you dont want to wrestle the climber on your back. Definitely a good buy. Always teather your upper and lower pieces! Wear your harness, dont be a statistic.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Butler

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: The seats are junk now. The webbing has come apart at the seam. The cables wear a lot faster than they used to.
customer_reviews.author: abamadude

customer_reviews.title: Needs better backpacking straps
customer_reviews.text: Great easy stand to use im 6’ 165lbs so perfect for me... very comfortable over all have sat all day multiple times I bow hunt Nothing getting in the way only downside is carrying is uncomfortable the included strap is trash id recommend buying Molle straps with this stand
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased and highly impressed
customer_reviews.text: It functions very nice in the field. Its easy to adjust when carrying extra gear, with a few carabiners and lashing straps, you can set it up for long range trips. I have the minviper too but this gives my 200lb body plenty of room. It's easy to manage when you working in the dark, assembly is very easy but I recommend practicing a few times before you actually use it. Worth the price for sure
customer_reviews.author: David English DDay

customer_reviews.title: Great stand!  Would buy another!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a pretty nice tree stand. Easy to figure out and get hunting. The only ding I’ll give it is that the cables immediately starting peeling(the coating on them). It doesn’t impact functionality, other then making it a little difficult to move them in and out. The good news is that they are clearly replaceable, and I’ve seen em online for <$50. Guessing theyll last a few seasons before they start rusting and needing replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Owens

customer_reviews.title: For the money you can’t go wrong
customer_reviews.text: I had to watch a video on you tube to figure out how to put the back pack strap on correctly, the dvd would not play, but I’m satisfied with the quality of Summit tree stands, I previously owned a mini viper that I loved because of the weight of the stand, full sized viper only weighs 2 Lbs more & it’s roomier than mini, in my personal opinion Summit stands are the best! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: James Monday

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is my first climbing stand so I didn’t really know what to expect. I’m very happy with the stand. The carrying straps have been upgraded from previous models and I find them very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son for his birthday . He loves it . Fast shipping .
customer_reviews.author: Linda 123

customer_reviews.title: Read this before buying
customer_reviews.text: The product is great but the viper is rated for 350 and I weigh 200 but my climber managed to bend some how. I haven’t even had it for 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: blake brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great tree stand. Any time I need a stand, this is the one I use. It’s not too heavy, it’s sturdy and safe, it’s comfortable, and not too difficult to work with in the field. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Petrillo

customer_reviews.title: Lite
customer_reviews.text: Lightest stand I have owned and the climbing seat will extend my hunting for the next 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Nonya

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't garantee a buck
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised! Great stand, aluminum, you should only buy this once in a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Jcnva

customer_reviews.title: Great but kind of small.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality all around. Smaller than I anticipated. Kind of tight sides and I'm not even that big. I'm 5ft 9" and 180lbs and its tight for me when I have my cold weather hunting gear on.
customer_reviews.author: Northern

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Nice stand but constantly slipped on my while climbing. The teeth on it are not very sharp so don’t bite well. Also harness it came with has very little slack from the tree, ended up using a different one that allowed more room.
customer_reviews.author: Travis J

customer_reviews.title: Best treestand ever
customer_reviews.text: A little on the heavy side but easily portable and easy to climb with. Super comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Justin Bormann

customer_reviews.title: No parts to lose out of the woods
customer_reviews.text: I'm average build and it's a little small on me but it's okay
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: first climber and this thing is great for setting up any way you want in a tree
customer_reviews.author: Terry Johns

customer_reviews.title: Great mobile climber!
customer_reviews.text: Super light, comfy for a 5’10 200 lb guy. Easy assembly. Only complaint would be the cable system catches and the rubber coating comes right off. Other than that, great stand!
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher McCarrick

customer_reviews.title: Great all purpose stand
customer_reviews.text: Great Stand! I used another brand of stand for all of my life and was stubborn about buying a summit even though I had friends recommend them. I bought a Razor for bowhunting and less than a year later got this one for gun hunting!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Tignor

customer_reviews.title: but this is nice, only thing is I wish was easier to ...
customer_reviews.text: my first stand so I have no comparable items I carried a lot of junk in the army so I just may be used to it, but this is nice, only thing is I wish was easier to strap one of my packs to its frame
customer_reviews.author: Michael S from NY

customer_reviews.title: Great Hunting Platform
customer_reviews.text: This climber takes some patience and physical work to set up and get where you need to be, but works great.
customer_reviews.author: KellyV_Ark

customer_reviews.title: Initial impressions are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Very light, great seat material. Even the back pack strap isn’t bad on this one. Comes with a cool Summit sticker as well. I have not climbed with it yet, but I know good quality when I see it.
customer_reviews.author: LANE

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for beginners and veterans alike
customer_reviews.text: First hunt with this stand, which was also my first time climbing with this, I got a great 8 point. This treestand is extremely comfortable and easy to use. I would highly recommend to anybody that is new to climbing treestands. The only issue I might have with it is the padding they give you to wrap around the bars are very loud, but I just took them off so it wasn't really an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jump on this stand!
customer_reviews.text: My first climbing tree stand and likely my last. Great USA build quality and very sturdy in the tree. I sat in mine for over two hours and I was very comfortable the whole time. Would highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Slewis

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This climber is awesome. Feels super secure. Your definitely going to get another harness, being that the one that comes with it is noisey and complicated to put on
customer_reviews.author: Charles E.

customer_reviews.title: The stand of all stands
customer_reviews.text: My favorite stand. Comfortable and secure. I can literally sit all day without being uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Summit Viper SD Treestand worked well for trimming palm trees.
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well. I am using it to climb my Mexican fan palms to trim the dead leaves. I saw that recommendation on a tree-trimming web-site. It was a little cumbersome to ride up and down the rough surface of the trunk, but it got the job done. The set-up instructions might have been more clear.
customer_reviews.author: David Q Dobras

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves this stand. Lightweight and comfy to sit in for hours at a time. Very please with how sturdy it is made as well
customer_reviews.author: Britney

customer_reviews.title: The seat gets in the way when combining the seat ...
customer_reviews.text: The seat gets in the way when combining the seat section with standing section in order to carry out.
customer_reviews.author: Rigoberto Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, lighter than my 20yr tree stand. Would let my girl friend buy it again for me. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Bo Duke

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Good product, shot a 10 point buck from it the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: impasko

customer_reviews.title: super comfortable. I'm 5'11" 165 lbs and I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, quiet, super comfortable. I'm 5'11" 165 lbs and I have tons of room for comfort. Their harness is easy to use as well. All in all it's a great package
customer_reviews.author: Corey Lindberg

customer_reviews.title: This is my first tree climber and I love it. Did not take to long to master ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first tree climber and I love it. Did not take to long to master going up and down a tree. Caught a deer second time using it. Only complaint that I do have is that it is harder to use on hardwood trees. Pine trees feels the securest.
customer_reviews.author: King Seal

customer_reviews.title: Buy It!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy for being aluminum but yet lightweight. I could sit in this stand all day with no issues of not being comfortable, Summit knows what they are doing for sure!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bigg Robb

customer_reviews.title: Good Climber
customer_reviews.text: Great climbing treestand. The only thing I didn't like was the backpack straps that come with it. They dont stay in place and the treestand will shift position while carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy the hunt from a summit.
customer_reviews.text: So this is my first tree climber and I could not be more happier with it. It’s light weight, quite, easy to use. And there are so many accessories that you can purchase to make the hunt more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves this stand. Quality is great and super durable and too heavy to carry
customer_reviews.author: C Steb

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic climber stand.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Summit. This thing is excellent and I would buy another viper in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this stand! So easy to use! I’m 5’2 130lb female and I can go up and down the tree with no problem. Seat is super comfortable, can’t wait to use this during deer season!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Betts

customer_reviews.title: First climbing treestand
customer_reviews.text: This was my first climbing treestand. It is lightweight, easy to assemble, and I felt completely safe when using it. I no longer need to bring my hotseat, since the seat is padded and extremely comfortable; not once did I have to stand up. The bar in front allowed me to rest my gun. I highly recommend this stand!
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised but finish is already coming off
customer_reviews.text: Unit works as advertised but the finish is already coming off before even getting to use.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and stable. Easy to pack in and out and quieter than me old stand.
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Mostly works as it’s supposed to. Couple nice improvements like the connection strap. Buy, check the dimentions, it’s not very wide
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Groeneveld

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: The best climbing stand on the market in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Ainsley

customer_reviews.title: Nice climbing stand
customer_reviews.text: Nice stand, fairly easy to assemble, and comfortable to sit in. The safety harness and tree strap could be better though.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Lawe

customer_reviews.title: Love this stand
customer_reviews.text: Love this stand; however, when delivered there was damage and I had to bang/bend back some of the aluminum where you put locking cable. It would not go in and lock.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: This is a must buy for you.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift and it worked great for deer season.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Larson Ripley

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and light. However I just received my stand and it was missing it’s seat. After over an hour on hold to customer support with summit. I have to wait a week to get the missing seat. I received my stand quicker. Now I’ll have to buy a seat to use the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Allen M.

customer_reviews.title: tree stand
customer_reviews.text: works as good as the other two we have great item
customer_reviews.author: Russell Ransburgh

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: A great climber. Very comfortable for long sits. Very easy to setup and light. I am very pleased withh this purchase. I also bought the side bags so I don't have to carry a backpack. A nice addition. Quality system.
customer_reviews.author: happy

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used an older version that my brother had, and then bought my own! BEST tree stand I've ever owned, let alone climber!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best noiseless Stand ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best noiseless Stand ever used. I had back surgery years ago and gave up bow hunting. Thought about giving it another try and this stand made it possible, unbelievably built
customer_reviews.author: Deak Bear

customer_reviews.title: Love my Viper SD
customer_reviews.text: Very light and solid stand. No slipping on tree when climbing and stays put when you reach the height you want. I feel very safe in this stand, its the best stand I have ever owned. I also like the way it packs, with good shoulder straps.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome climber
customer_reviews.text: Still getting used to it but seems to by a very nice rock solid stand. This is my first climber so I am a little uneasy about it but I'm doing good. I am 6' 2" 175 pounds and it climbs good. Sometimes when climbing the teeth dig into the tree so far that its hard to get it lose to keep climing the tree. Other than that great stand!!!
customer_reviews.author: Austin broadway

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Best climber as far as I can see, safe and works great !
customer_reviews.author: Dannyboy5114

customer_reviews.title: Great climber, included safety equipment gets the job done but is difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: Get your own harness and safety line to make this climber ultra safe.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sauer

customer_reviews.title: Summit need to add a custom engraving section and an engraved serial number
customer_reviews.text: Great stand but unfortunate they do get stolen even with a lock. Would be useful if Summit engrave a large visible serial number plus custom engraving
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG ALEXANDER ALLAN

customer_reviews.title: It delivers
customer_reviews.text: It delivers. Lightweight, very sturdy and comfortable. Easy to carry. I bought stabilizer straps and they just made it that much safer. Price was good.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger H Easley

customer_reviews.title: This is a great climbing tree stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great climbing tree stand; lightweight, easy to set up and use, safe and quiet, pretty comfortable to set in for long periods of time. My biggest negative is the carry strap harness. It is almost like it was an afterthought and just something thrown together and added to the package
customer_reviews.author: Steve Gillis

customer_reviews.title: What can I say. It’s a Summit!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable both on my back when hiking and mounted On the tree! Thanks, guys!
customer_reviews.author: J. Price

customer_reviews.title: Just awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, fast climbing, comfortable, and solid purchase in the tree. What more do you need from a climbing treestand!? Excellence!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Very secure and stable when secured properly.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Summit Viper I have bought. Very well made and very secure and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ricky price

product_meta.title: Summit Treestands 81120 Viper SD Climbing Treestand, Mossy Oak
product_meta.description: Engineered to keep you comfortable and concealed, the Viper SD is Summit’s most popular model and has been for 17 years. Featuring a foam-padded seat that can be raised for bow hunting and lowered for gun hunting, the Viper SD’s full-perimeter frame allows for sit-down and stand-up configurations while a solid front bar enables easy climbing and doubles as a gun rest. Quiet, comfortable and safe, the Viper weighs in at a highly portable 20 pounds, with a nesting frame that packs on your back. PROVEN RELIABILITY: Built to last, the Viper SD Climbing Tree Stand is covered by Summit’s 5-Year Limited Warranty. DEADMETAL SOUND-DEADENING TECHNOLOGY: Critical parts of your tree stand’s platform are filled in with a custom-engineered expanding foam to reduce unintentional noises. QUICKDRAW CABLE RETENTION SYSTEM: The simplest, fastest and quietest cable attachment system ever invented, no fumbling with pins, knobs, nuts or bolts necessary. Size the cable to your tree’s diameter, insert the cable into the retention bracket, and the QuickDraw trigger locks securely in place. Pull the “trigger” to remove the stand from the tree. SUMMITLOKT STRUCTURAL ENHANCEMENT: High-quality extruded aluminum and precision welds provide maximum rigidity and strength. Each joint is “locked” into place before welding and designed so that stress on the welds is minimized, for a stand that’s strong, safe, secure and silent. RAPIDCLIMB CLIMBING STIRRUPS: A standard feature on all Summit climbing stands, RapidClimb stirrups are easy to use and adjustable to fit any boot. Designed to keep your boot securely attached to the platform, these ergonomic stirrups allow you to quickly and safely climb to your desired height.
feature_bullets: Suspended foam-padded seat with backrest in Mossy Oak Break-Up Infinity camo
Weighs 20 lbs. and holds up to 300 lbs. Green Utility Strap
18” W x 12” D seat size, 20” W x 26.5" D platform size
Includes Full-Body Fall Arrest Harness System and all necessary hardware. Versatility, comfort and functionality while being lightweight
